page.title: 10BENENDEN WEALD, CHANGES.
page.content: We took the opportunity to re-survey the grid sqare that was studied as part of the Countrysides Commission's changing countryside survey in 1968, Square 578133. We read a great deal about the dramatic changes which are taking place but we found very little. The built up area was exactly the same as in 1968 as was the balance between grassland and arable land. No fences or hedges had been completely removed. At a few points, field boundaries appeared to have changed but it is often very difficult to distinguish between a fence, a low, and a tall hedge and a low one that needs cutting. These minor changes can easily be explained by the different opinions of the observers! This is perhaps a reflection of the unchanging face of the area.
